definitions.definition: kept as a prisoner or in a space that you cannot get out of; unable to escape

examples.text: They were **taken captive** by masked gunmen.
captive breeding *(= the breeding of wild animals in zoos, etc.)*
She was held captive in a castle.

definitions.definition: not free to leave a particular place or to choose what you want to do

examples.text: A salesman loves to have a **captive audience** *(= listening because they have no choice)*.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin captivus, from capere ‘seize, take’.
